roles.name: Urban Planner
roles.description: Designs efficient transport networks within cities, balancing pedestrian, cycling, public transit, and road systems for sustainable mobility.

meta.typicalBackground: Urban planning or civil engineering degree, GIS proficiency, stakeholder engagement skills
challenges: Budget constraints, political approval, balancing diverse commuter preferences

sampleUseCase.scenario: The planner proposes a bus rapid transit (BRT) corridor with dedicated lanes and integrated fare systems, cutting average commute times by 25% in a congested urban district.

roles.name: Logistics Coordinator
roles.description: Organizes freight movement, managing schedules, routes, and shipping modes to minimize costs and delays.

meta.typicalBackground: Logistics or supply chain diploma/degree, strong organization and real-time problem-solving
challenges: Fuel price volatility, custom clearance, last-mile delivery complexities in urban areas

sampleUseCase.scenario: A coordinator employs route optimization algorithms to consolidate deliveries and reduce truck mileage, saving fuel and cutting CO2 emissions by 10% monthly.

roles.name: Public Transit Operator
roles.description: Operates buses, trains, or trams, adhering to schedules, safety standards, and passenger service protocols.

meta.typicalBackground: Commercial driving license, training in traffic rules, strong safety orientation
challenges: Traffic congestion, unpredictable passenger volumes, ensuring on-time performance in adverse weather

sampleUseCase.scenario: A bus operator adjusts headways during peak hours based on real-time passenger load data, reducing overcrowding and improving user satisfaction.

roles.name: Traffic Engineer
roles.description: Analyzes flow patterns, designs intersection layouts, traffic signals, and control systems to reduce congestion and accidents.

meta.typicalBackground: Civil engineering with specialization in traffic/transport, strong modeling and data analysis skills
challenges: Limited road space, driver behavior unpredictability, political/institutional constraints on big infrastructure changes

sampleUseCase.scenario: The engineer reconfigures a busy junction with adaptive signal control and protected left turns, cutting average intersection wait times by 35% and improving safety for cyclists.

roles.name: Freight Forwarder
roles.description: Manages the import/export logistics on behalf of shippers, handling customs clearance, shipping documents, and carrier selection.

meta.typicalBackground: International trade/logistics experience, knowledge of INCOTERMS, customs regulations
challenges: Paperwork errors causing delays, currency shifts, unpredictable port congestion

sampleUseCase.scenario: A forwarder consolidates shipments from multiple SMEs, negotiating a better rate with the ocean carrier and smoothing out customs processes at the destination port.
